meanings.definition: The act of sending or transmitting something.
meanings.sent1: The immittances of messages through email are quick and efficient.
meanings.sent2: The immittances of packages through the postal service ensure timely delivery.
meanings.sent3: The immittances of gossip in our small town always lead to interesting conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an immittance of warmth that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The immittance of sunlight through the window filled the room with a golden glow.

meanings.definition: The amount of money or goods sent or received.
meanings.sent1: He carefully tracked the immittances of funds into his bank account.
meanings.sent2: The immittances of donations to the charity helped many people in need.
meanings.sent3: The immittances of chocolates from her admirer always brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an immittance of joy that was contagious to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The immittance of gifts during the holiday season made the children excited.

meanings.definition: The process of granting permission or approval.
meanings.sent1: The immittances of access to the restricted area were closely monitored.
meanings.sent2: The immittances of visas for international travel can sometimes be complex.
meanings.sent3: The immittances of extra dessert after dinner were always met with cheers.
meanings.sent4: His nod was an immittance of agreement to proceed with the plan.
meanings.sent5: The immittance of keys to the new house symbolized a fresh start for the family.
